alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:22PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Knox and Whitley Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Walden, or near Williamsburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Barton around 125 PM EDT. Rockholds, Faber and Wofford around 130 PM EDT. Woodbine, Suttons Mill, Yaden and Moore Hill around 135 PM EDT. Perkins, Wilton, Julip, Lucky and Verne around 140 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Louden, Bertha Station, Permon, Indian Creek, Gausdale, Arkle, Rossland, Clate, King, Dishman Springs, Emmanuel, Lowell, Bentley Station, Carpenter, Garrich, Barbourville, Swan Lake, Swanpond, Bryants Store, Heidrick, Baileys Switch and Cannon. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 4 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
